bug.short_desc: Please build for python2 and python3

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
pyephem do support python3. please update spec file. Have put together proof of conept build here:
http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=13282926
Have tested, does work. Much improve.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): rpm -q pyephem pyephem-3.7.6.0-2.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Now is so
Steps to Reproduce: 1. koji build --scratch rawhide pyephem-3.7.6.0-2.fc24.src.rpm 2. look at build artifact
Actual results: output be python-pyephem-3.7.6.0-2.fc25.arch.rpm
Expected results: output be python2-pyephem-3.7.6.0-2.fc25.arch.rpm output be python3-pyephem-3.7.6.0-2.fc25.arch.rpm much happiness and profit
Additional info: I am not a tree. I identify as meat popsickle.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
pyephem-3.7.6.0-7.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-06be0c1acd
pyephem-3.7.6.0-7.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-e3517aa20b
pyephem-3.7.6.0-7.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-a5f1ae8cf3

pyephem-3.7.6.0-7.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
